description: From Middle English lykewise, lykewyse, lyke wyse, lijk wise, a shortened form of Middle English in lik wise (“in like wise”); equivalent to like +‎ -wise. Compare with otherwise.

examples: Public transportation is virtually inaccessible in this country; likewise, its hospitals are also not very user-friendly.
Margaret enjoys playing tennis on Saturdays, Jeremy likewise.

entries.meaning: The same to you; used as a response.
examples: It was very nice meeting you, Samantha. ― Likewise, Mr Thompson.
